title: What did colonists do about the Stamp Act? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Can only speak for my ancestors who was a member of the Sons of Liberty, a grandfather, and another who was the moderator of the coffee house where the following action was planned: As a Son of Liberty, my grandfather, dressed up like an Indian, went aboard a ship in Boston Harbor and threw boxes of tea overboard, A symbolic rejection of the stamp act. Remembered fondly in history books in the US.

Instead of levying a duty on trade goods, the Stamp Act imposed a direct tax on the colonists. Specifically, the act required that starting in the fall of 1765, legal documents and printed materials must bear a tax stamp provided by commissioned distributors who would collect the tax in exchange for the stamp.
